TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TypedArray extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary:
Container for an array of values that were retrieved with
or .

remarks.para:
Container for an array of values that were retrieved with
or . Be sure to call when done with them.
The indices used to retrieve values from this structure correspond to the positions of the attributes given to obtainStyledAttributes.

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

Docs.param: Value to return if the attribute is not defined or not a resource.
Docs.summary: Retrieve a dimensional unit attribute at index.

remarks.para: Retrieve a dimensional unit attribute at index. Unit conversions are based on the current associated with the resources this object came from.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int GetDimensionPixelOffset (int index, int defValue);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetDimensionPixelOffset(int32 index, int32 defValue) cil managed

Docs.param: Value to return if the attribute is not defined or not a resource.
Docs.summary: Retrieve a dimensional unit attribute at index for use as an offset in raw pixels.

remarks.para: Retrieve a dimensional unit attribute at index for use as an offset in raw pixels. This is the same as , except the returned value is converted to integer pixels for you. An offset conversion involves simply truncating the base value to an integer.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int GetDimensionPixelSize (int index, int defValue);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetDimensionPixelSize(int32 index, int32 defValue) cil managed

Docs.param: Value to return if the attribute is not defined or not a resource.
Docs.summary: Retrieve a dimensional unit attribute at index for use as a size in raw pixels.

remarks.para: Retrieve a dimensional unit attribute at index for use as a size in raw pixels. This is the same as , except the returned value is converted to integer pixels for use as a size. A size conversion involves rounding the base value, and ensuring that a non-zero base value is at least one pixel in size.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string GetNonResourceString (int index);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetNonResourceString(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieve the string value for the attribute at index, but only if that string comes from an immediate value in an XML file.

remarks.para: Retrieve the string value for the attribute at index, but only if that string comes from an immediate value in an XML file. That is, this does not allow references to string resources, string attributes, or conversions from other types. As such, this method will only return strings for TypedArray objects that come from attributes in an XML file.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int GetResourceId (int index, int defValue);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetResourceId(int32 index, int32 defValue) cil managed

Docs.param: Value to return if the attribute is not defined or not a resource.
Docs.summary: Retrieve the resource identifier for the attribute at index.

remarks.para: Retrieve the resource identifier for the attribute at index. Note that attribute resource as resolved when the overall object is retrieved. As a result, this function will return the resource identifier of the final resource value that was found, not necessarily the original resource that was specified by the attribute.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
